category: Member Sports Organization Regulations/Article 25-2 (Calculation of Number of Reappointment)
contents: Article 25-2 (Calculation of the number of reappointments) ① When calculating the number of reappointments of an executive, the following items shall apply, and the experience of executives of other member sports organizations shall also be included. 1. When calculating the number of reappointments of the Chairman, the period of time served as an officer other than the Chairman is not included. Revised on October 6, 2021. When calculating the number of reappointments of the vice president, the period served as president is included, but the period served as director and auditor is not included. Revised on October 6, 3, 2021. When calculating the number of reappointments of directors and auditors (excluding accounting auditors), the period served as chairman and vice president is included. Revised on July 29, 2020. ② When calculating the number of times an executive has been reappointed, the reappointment is calculated as one reappointment if the executive has a history of working as an executive within the previous or subsequent terms, regardless of whether the expiration date of the previous term and the date of inauguration as the successor are consecutive. (Includes cases of resignation during the term of office.) ③ Officers elected by-election and officers appointed through augmentation under Article 25, Paragraph 3 shall be calculated as having served once, regardless of the period of office. However, if a resigned executive is elected or increased to an executive position within the same term, the number of terms of office will not be additionally calculated. ④ Notwithstanding Article 25 (1), executives of member sports organizations may be recognized as exceptions to the limitation on the number of reappointments for executives pursuant to Articles 18 and 20 of the Sports Fair Committee Regulations of the Sports Association. [This Article Newly Inserted on November 7, 2019. ]
